quote: Ship's log, First Officer Riker   reporting. Stardate 41997.7 We   are about to make a brief but   necessary contact with the Jarada,   a reclusive race known for its   idiosyncratic attitude towards   protocol... The Federation has been   trying unsuccessfully to establish   a relationship, and now the task   falls to Captain Picard.
scene: 1    EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE (OPTICAL)

quote: ... In two days we will reach the   area of their planet, known as   Torona Four. The Jarada demand   a precise greeting. Their   language is most unusual...
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: ... The slightest mispronunciation   is regarded as an insult.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: The double bars indicate an   elongated "s" sound --
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: -- And the inverted "T" means to   hold the "zee."
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Unless... ?
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Unless it's followed by three wavy   lines; in which case the "zee"   becomes a "bee."
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Exactly.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: What a language.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: It is an insect mind.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: My mind's barely working.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Take a break, sir.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: No. I want to go over it again.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: You could be over-preparing.   You've been looking forward to   the upgrade of the Holodeck. You   have the time. You need the   diversion...
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Dixon Hill.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: The program's installed and   waiting.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Planet and city?

quote: Earth... United States... San   Francisco, California.
scene: 7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD

scene: 7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD
7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: File or access code.
scene: 7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: File Dixon Hill, private   detective.
scene: 7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Enter when ready.
scene: 7    INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Very funny, Dix. What'd you do,   lose another bet?
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: I don't understand --
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: The bellboy suit. Are you   moonlighting at the Fremont?
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: The uniform. Totally   inappropriate. Why didn't I   change?
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Mister Leech called twice, and   there's a lady named Bradley   waiting in your office. Nice   legs.
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Gotta hot date with my fella.   I'll see ya in the morning.
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Uh, I lost a bet.
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Oh well... At least you're ready   for Halloween.
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Halloween?
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: I need your help, Mister Hill.       Someone is trying to kill me.
scene: 9    INT. WAITING ROOM/OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Captain's log, supplemental. I   am delighted with how the   Holodeck has created the   fictional world of Dixon Hill...
scene: 10   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE (OPTICAL)

quote: ... the twentieth century   detective who has been a hero of   mine since childhood.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: The illusion is flawless. The   computer characters accept me as   Dixon Hill, even to the extent that   Jessica Bradley, a millionaire's   wife from the wrong side of the   tracks, wants to hire me.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: I'm not sure who wants me dead.   My husband... My stepdaughter...
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Or a lover, perhaps?
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Perhaps.       Perhaps Cyrus Redblock.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: I need you to find out. Name   your fee.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Twenty dollars a day. Plus   expenses.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Agreed.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: I haven't said yes yet.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Oh you'll say yes.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: If it's Redblock, he must think   I've got what he's looking for.   But believe me, I don't.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: I'll take your word for it.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Here's a C-note in advance.   Consider it a retainer...    (day as she touches     his uniform)   ... and next time, could you wear   a suit?
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Remarkable.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: You'll have to call again. I'm   just leaving. I'm not dressed   properly. I'll be back.
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Not yet, please --
scene: 11   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON PICARD

quote: Memory: save current setting.

quote: Current setting saved.

scene: 15   INT. ENTERPRISE - ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON PICARD

quote: When I looked down on the street,   I actually saw automobiles!
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: An ancient Earth device used   primarily for transportation.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Ahh.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Also seen as a source of status   and virility; often a prime   ingredient in teenage mating   rituals --
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Teenage mating rituals?
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I saw an entire city block from   that window.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It sounds wonderful.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'm going to try it again, only   this time I'm going to dress the   part.       Why not come with me?
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I also want to take that   historian... the twentieth century   expert...
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Whalen.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Yes, Whalen. He probably knows   more about Dixon Hill than I do.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I will tell him.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Invite him, Mister Data. This   is, after all, a leisure activity.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: The sense of reality is   incredible. When that woman   kissed me, it was so --
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Exciting?
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Real.       The subject of this meeting is   the Jaradan rendezvous. Proceed   with the briefing, Number One.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: This is primarily a necessary   diplomatic mission. The Jaradan   are strategically important to the   Federation. Previous attempts   failed because they are so easily   irritated. A slip in the   pronunciation of the greeting   caused a twenty-year rift in the   relation.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Therefore the captain must recite   the entire greeting without any   mistakes.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Simple as that.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Yes. If, on the other hand, the   captain makes even the slightest   error --
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: -- The captain is well aware of   the gravity of the situation,   Commander.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I have located a history tape   of the last Federation starship   to come in contact with the   Jarada. It graphically   demonstrates what happened when   that captain offended them.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: The captain is familiar with that,   Data.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Should we not run it?
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It's not necessary. Meeting   adjourned.
scene: 18   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Why would the captain not want   to review all the information   available on the subject?
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

quote: When you've seen the Jaradan   react once, you don't ever have   to see it again.
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Dixon Hill is a most puzzling   character.
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Not really. He was just a   twentieth-century Sherlock   Holmes.
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

quote: But his modus operandi is quite   dissimilar. Worth investigating.
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Indubitably, Watson.
scene: 26   INT. CORRIDOR - ON DATA AND GEORDI

scene: 27   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON DATA

quote: Request complete text of all   stories involving said character.
scene: 27   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON DATA

quote: Increase speed.
scene: 27   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON DATA

quote: Captain's log, supplemental...
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: The Jaradan rendezvous is eleven   hours away...
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: I am about to reenter the world   of Dixon Hill, this time properly   dressed. An experience like this   is more enjoyable when shared,   so I've invited Lit-historian   Whalen to accompany me. Doctor   Crusher will join us shortly...
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: Ready to go to San Francisco,   Mister Whalen?
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: More than ready, sir.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: If it's anything like the last   time I'm sure you won't be   disappointed --
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: Request permission to accompany   you, sir.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: I have mastered the lingo of the   period. Example:       It was raining in the city of   Angels -- a hard rain -- almost hard   enough to wash the slime from the   streets. But it never does. When   the rain stops, the boulevard   dries and the snakes once again   slink from their holes. That's   when my door opens and the   helpless, the desperate, walk   through with a heart full of hurt   and a pocket full of nothing.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: It unearthed half-forgotten   feelings the same way it dug up   sleeping bones in shallow unmarked   graves.       It was that kind of day.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: Dixon Hill: "The Black Orchid,"   Chapter Three.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: Very impressive, gentlemen.   Now... Shall we?
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: Hey Dix!
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: How's tricks?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Uh, she's fine... just fine.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Wonderful! He really thinks   you're Dixon Hill!
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Say Joe, I'd like to buy a paper   too, but I don't have any money.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Catch me next time, Dix.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Baseball. A national obsession   at the time.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: The streak they refer to, will   eventually reach fifty-six   games...
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Cleveland!!!
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: They got no pitching! They never   got no pitching. What are ya,   nuts or somethin'?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: The record will stand until the   year 2026, when a shortstop for   the London Kings--
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: (to Picard,     interrupting)   Hey Dix, what gives with this guy?    (leans forward, studies     Data's face)   He ain't from around here, is he?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Uh, no... he's not.       He's from South America.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Yeah. He's got a nice tan.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: I should have listened to her.   She told me someone was trying   to kill her.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: She's a page from a book, sir.   That's all she ever was.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Well, well, look what the cat   dragged in.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Cat?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: What on Earth... Where the hell   did he come from?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: South America. Can't you tell?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Wherever you're from, while   you're in my town, keep your nose   clean.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Well, tough guy, this time you've   really done it. Your goose is   cooked, but good.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: I'm sorry about this, Dix.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Don't apologize to him'       Where were you last night between   ten and midnight?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: That would be a bit hard to   explain.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Yeah? Well you'll have plenty   of time to come up with something.   You're goin' downtown.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: What for?
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: For the murder of Jessica Bradley.
scene: 39   EXT. SIDEWALK - NIGHT - TIGHT ON PICARD, WHALEN AND

quote: Status report?
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We're being probed, sir.
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: The Jarada.

scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: One could get the feeling they   don't exactly trust us.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Commander, I'm receiving a   subspace message from the Jarada.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: That's not part of the plan.       Pipe it through.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: En-ter-prise. The time has come   to honor us. We await your   greeting.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: This is Commander Riker, first   officer of the Enterprise --
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: -- You are not captain?!
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: No sir, I'm not. I suggest we   commence with screen to screen   communication so we can see each   other --
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: -- You offend us! We will not   show ourselves to a mere   subordinate. We await your   captain's greeting with growing   unrest. End of communication!
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Terrific.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Get the captain. You'll find   him in the Holodeck.
scene: 45   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Hiya Doc. What's shakin'?       Are you alright?
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: I'm just a little dizzy, thank   you. I had some trouble coming   through. Where's Captain Picard?
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: He's on ice.
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: Pardon?
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: He's being grilled.
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: What is he Data, a fish?
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: The captain's being interrogated.       They think he's committed a   murder.
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: Shouldn't we be doing something   to help him?
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: Relax Doctor. It's all part of   the game. Believe me, he's having   the time of his life in there.
scene: 48   INT. POLICE STATION - ON BEVERLY

quote: I've told you everything I know.

quote: Very good. I've read all this   before. It's exactly as it should   be.

scene: 50   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE (CORRIDOR) - CLOSE ON GEORDI

scene: 54   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE (CORRIDOR) - ON GEORDI

quote: Ship's log, supplemental. First   officer reporting. Due to an   unknown breakdown in the Holodeck,   we are unable to locate the   captain and his party...
scene: 55   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE (OPTICAL)

quote: Tasha, take over. I'm going to   Holdeck Three.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - OVERHEAD SHOT, MOVING IN ON RIKER

quote: Commander?... I've studied all   the technical manuals on the   Holodeck. I think I could be of   some help down there.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - OVERHEAD SHOT, MOVING IN ON RIKER

quote: Geordi's well equipped to deal   with the situation, Wes. Right   now, your duties are on the   bridge.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - OVERHEAD SHOT, MOVING IN ON RIKER

quote: His mother's in there too, sir.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - OVERHEAD SHOT, MOVING IN ON RIKER

quote: Come on, Wesley.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - OVERHEAD SHOT, MOVING IN ON RIKER

quote: ... And you say you'd never met   her before she came to hire you.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I've already told you that.   Twice.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Yeah? Well you're gonna tell me   again.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Look fellows, this is no longer   amusing.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Easy, Mike!
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: You think you're tough, Hill!   But you're nothing! You're   garbage!
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I need to get out of here.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Yeah. I'll see what I can do.
scene: 59   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Something on your mind?
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Is that good?
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It ain't bad. You like Charlie   McCarthy?
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: McCarthy?... Oh, you mean the man   who hunted Communist witches.
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I got two tickets to the show   tomorrow night.
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Do you mind if I experiment with   this device?
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I don't care what you do.
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Thanks, Mac.
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Who is this jerk?
scene: 60   INT. POLICE STATION WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Okay Dix. We're bustin' you out   of here.

quote: That's welcome news.

quote: You better not try to leave town.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It's been a pleasure, sir.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I get the feeling he doesn't like   me.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We know you're dealing with The   Fat Man, Dixon. Take it from a   friend; it doesn't help your case.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'll keep it in mind.

quote: Thank you. For helping me.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Forget it.       When you comin' over for supper?   The kids'd love to see you, and   you know how much you love   Sharon's cooking.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Soon, my friend. But at the   moment I have other duties.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Blonde or brunette?
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: She's a lady all right... and her   name's Enterprise.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Sounds like a working girl.       I'll stop by the office with a   bottle of scotch. You can tell   me all about her.
scene: 61   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Have a good time?
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'm not sure. Sometimes it seemed   too real.       Glad you could make it.       I must say, you wear it well.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Why thank you, Mister Hill.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I think it's time we got back to   the Enterprise.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We are on the Enterprise, Captain.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Yes. Of course we are.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Do we have time to see your   office?
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I don't see why not.
scene: 62   INT. WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: The Holodeck makes excellent use   of a finite space.
scene: 63   INT. OPEN DOOR LEADING TO HALLWAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Ah, Mister Hill. You've been   avoiding me.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: It's Felix Leech! It has to be.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: You know me, sir?
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: Well, I've read about you. Many   times.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: I'm sorry Mister Leech, but we   really must be going. Call again   tomorrow.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: You're being quite rude, Mister   Hill. You haven't even introduced   me to your charming companions.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: That'll have to wait.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: We have business! Urgent   business.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: You're not going anywhere. Not   until we have a little chat.
scene: 64   INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM

quote: Bridge to Holodeck. We're   approaching Torona Four.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE

quote: Any word from the Jarada?
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Not a thing, sir.
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: They may be testing us. Seeing   if we'll stick to the   arrangements.
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: What do we do now, sir?
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: We wait.
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Everything checks out so far.   Ensign Crusher believes the   trouble may have been caused by   the Jaradan probe. If so, it   could be very difficult to   locate.
scene: 68   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I'm not a man to be toyed with,   Mister Hill. You were hired to   locate a certain object. I demand   to know what you've done with it.
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I can't help you, Mister Leech.   I'm afraid this game is over.
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I assure you, this is no game!
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Take it from me Leech, you'll   never find it.       Now... give me the gun.
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: But... they're not real.
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: This man has been shot. If we   don't get him to Sickbay, he'll   die.
scene: 71   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: There's massive internal bleeding --
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: How could this happen?
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It'll happen again if you don't   cooperate.
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: You struck me! How dare you!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: (continuing; almost     hyperventilating)   You'll be sorry! The Fat Man   isn't going to like this!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We have to get him to Sickbay!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Exit!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Computer! Exit!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We'll try the other exit.
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Computer! Identify exit!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: There is a programming   malfunction. The computer refuses   to identify the exits.
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'm losing his pulse!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Computer, this is the captain!   Identify exit!
scene: 72   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Standard orbit, Mister Worf.
scene: 73   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Aye sir, standard orbit.
scene: 73   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Riker to Holodeck.
scene: 75   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING RIKER

quote: Nothing yet, Commander.
scene: 76   INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ON GEORDI AND WESLEY

quote: We're running out of time.
scene: 77   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON RIKER

quote: It's no use. It's just not here   anymore.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Suggestions, Mister Data?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I am at a loss. We are in a   Holodeck-created building of 1941.   The computer has refused to accept   voice commands. The controls for   the environment are therefore not   accessible. They are outside in   the reality of the Holodeck.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I could use some light.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: (gravelly, clipped     British accent)   Good day, Mister Hill. My name   is Cyrus Redblock. I hope you   don't mind us dropping in.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I see I have no choice.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Life is an endless stream of   choices. Unfortunately, you have   chosen to make my life more   difficult.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I don't suppose you'd be foolish   enough to hide it here.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I don't suppose so.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Still, I'm sure you won't mind   if we take a look around.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I wish you'd quit asking, since   it's obvious you're going to do   it anyway. It's a big waste of   time.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Good manners, Madam, are never   a waste.       Civility, gentlemen. Always   civility.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Get that stiff out of here.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: He's not dead.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: From his pallor, he soon will be.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: You want I should throw him in   the garbage, boss?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: The next room will do nicely for   now.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Which one struck you?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It was Hill.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: For every action, there is an   equal and opposite reaction. A   truism that you have sadly   neglected.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I saw your light and figured you   were working late.       Guess I was right.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Nice company you're keeping, Dix.   You forget to take the trash out   this morning?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'm a tolerant man, but I don't   tolerate disrespect.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Your devotion to etiquette is   highly admirable, sir. However,   your methods leave much to be   desired.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: What have we here?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Looks like a ghost.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Where do you suppose he's from?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Where were you hatched, anyway?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Central America.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: (fascinated,     half-whisper)   I've been all over this world and   I must say, I've not seen anything   like you.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: He's not from this world. None   of us are.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We come from a world of fabulous   riches. A world of objects --   far greater in value than the one   you seek.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: That's ridiculous! You're a   private dick. We've met before   and you never mentioned any of   this.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: He's right, Dix. That's pretty   weak stuff. I can't even buy   that line of guff.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I am not Dixon Hill.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: He's not!
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I only look like Dixon Hill.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: He speaks the truth, sir. From   your point of view, he is only   a fiction, a facsimile, a   knock-off, a cheap imitation.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Thank you, Mister Data.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Sorry sir, that did not come out   quite the way I interded.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Very good. Very, very, good.   What wonderful fiction! Quite   entertaining. I admire your skill   at trying to obfuscate our sense   of reality.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It is you who are not real, sir.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Data--
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: It is you who are imaginary   characters derived from a work   of fiction.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Give it up, fellas. These guys   are too smart to fall for that   story.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I am afraid you are not real either,   Lieutenant.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I don't want to hear any more   of this! You're making me crazy!
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Deep down, you all sense the   truth. Deep down, you know you're   not real. All of you.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Shut up!!       Let me shoot them, Mister   Redblock. Let me kill them, one   by one.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: A most interesting situation.   Perhaps we should test this   theory by killing one of them.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: You've already done that! This   man is dying! This whole thing   is senseless!
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Hardly! Senseless killing is   immoral. But killing for a   purpose is often ingenious.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Well said, Mister Redblock.   What's our purpose?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We are on a quest for knowledge,   Mister Leech.       We want the item.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: We don't have it.
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Shall I kill him?
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: No, kill the woman!
scene: 81   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Redblock. I have the item.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: At last. I knew it! God, man,   you are a character! Waiting   until the last moment! Testing   my resolve! What an ally you   would make! Now -- where is it?
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'll explain. But first, tell   Leech to back off.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Put the gun down, Mister Leech.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: But I want to kill her!
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Perhaps later. It won't harm us   to listen to Mister Hill.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Don't make any deals with that   slime, Dix!
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Begin. Make your thoughts   fruitful and your words eloquent.       Your lovely friend's life depends   upon it.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: There is a price.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: By God, man, I knew we were of   the same stripe. Name it.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Mister Whalen's life. You must   help us save him.
scene: 96   INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: What the devil --
scene: 101  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Probes! I'm reading several   of them, sir. All locked on to   us.
scene: 101  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Verified. Coming from the   Jaradans!
scene: 101  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Open hailing frequencies.
scene: 103  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Frequencies open, sir.
scene: 103  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: This is Commander Riker, aboard   the Enterprise. We demand that   you --
scene: 103  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: (continuing; holding     ears)   Cut that off!
scene: 103  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Lieutenant La Forge to bridge.
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: Riker here.
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: Is everything all right, sir?   We felt quite a surge down here   --
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: Yes. Status report.
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: We think we have something, sir.   I'll let Ensign Crusher explain.
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: I've found three --
scene: 104  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI

quote: Forget the explanation! Can you   repair it?
scene: 105  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON RIKER

quote: I don't know if I should. If   this isn't done correctly, the   program could abort and everyone   inside could vanish.
scene: 106  INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ON WESLEY

quote: Do you need more time to study   it?
scene: 106  INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ON WESLEY

quote: No, sir. Whether we do it now   or later, the risk will be the   same.
scene: 106  INT. HOLODECK ENTRANCE - ON WESLEY

quote: Do it.
scene: 107  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON RIKER

quote: (passionate, to     Redblock)   If we can find the way of getting   him to our Sickbay by fixing our   computer --
scene: 108  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Computer? I do not know this   word.
scene: 108  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: -- A mechanical or electronic   apparatus capable of carrying out   repetitious and highly complex   mathematical operations at high   speed.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Computers are used to control,   perform, process, or store --
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Enough!       Let me kill him. He's beginning   to irritate me.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Captain, the exit...
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: That's it! The way into our   world.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Remarkable. Is this a two-way   passage? Can one enter your world   and return to this one simply by   stepping through?
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Yes. Allow us to help Mister   Whalen, and we'll return with   the item.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: By God, sir, you are a scamp!   To think that I would wait here   --
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: If you are thinking of going   through yourself sir, I can assure   you that is not possible.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Not possible!       One look at you sir, proves   anything is possible.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Stand back, Mister Hill. I would   shoot you myself, but I don't want   to rob my assistant of his   greatest pleasure.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Thanks, boss.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: After we've gone, kill them all.   Make sure no one ever finds the   bodies.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: You're insane! You think you can   kill a cop and get away with it?
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Why not? I've done it before.   Come, Mister Leech.
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Our destiny awaits.       Au revoir et bon chance, mon ami!
scene: 110  INT. DIXON HILL'S OFFICE - ON DATA, REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Another world.       A whole new world to plunder!
scene: 120  INT. ENTERPRISE HALLWAY - CLOSE ON REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Uh-oh.     REDBLOCK       What is it?
scene: 120  INT. ENTERPRISE HALLWAY - CLOSE ON REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: What is it?
scene: 120  INT. ENTERPRISE HALLWAY - CLOSE ON REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: Nooo!! I want to live!! I want--
scene: 120  INT. ENTERPRISE HALLWAY - CLOSE ON REDBLOCK AND LEECH

quote: We've done it, but still no sign   of them.
scene: 122  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON GEORDI AND WESLEY

quote: Should we go inside?
scene: 124  INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK

quote: (to Data, indicating     Exit)   Pick him up. Get him to Sickbay.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: What about you?
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I'll follow you. Now go!
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I can't think of a way to thank   you. You know I can't take you   with me.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Someone's gotta book this creep.       Once a cop always a cop, I guess.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I have to go.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: So this is the big good-bye.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Tell me something, Dixon.       When you've gone.... will this   world still exist?.. Will my wife   and kids still be waiting for me   at home?
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: I honestly don't know. Good-bye   my friend.
scene: 125  INT. DIXON HILL'S WAITING ROOM - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Captain!
scene: 129  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Are you ready, sir?
scene: 129  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: As ready as I'll ever be. Open   hailing frequencies.
scene: 129  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Frequencies open.
scene: 129  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: (into com,     commandingly)   This is Jean-Luc Picard, captain   of the USS Enterprise. Aaaaard   kraxon Leeeeesss...
scene: 129  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE

quote: Risssssss... Trassssss.... Trasulah!
scene: 131  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE (OPTICAL)

quote: You have... honored us with   your words of greeting. A new   day dawns between us.
scene: 131  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE (OPTICAL)

quote: So... Have a nice vacation?
scene: 131  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE (OPTICAL)

quote: It was a nice place to visit,   but I wouldn't want to die there.
scene: 131  INT. MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE (OPTICAL)
